info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 13 at 1:00PM PDT until April 14 at 1:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Mountain Snow this Evening through Thursday... .A storm system will create hazardous driving conditions in the mountains above 4,500 feet this evening into Thursday afternoon and through 11 pm PDT Thursday night for elevations above 5,500 feet. Motorists should plan ahead for delays and chain controls and are encouraged to check with CalTrans for the latest road conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 PM PDT THURSDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including during the evening commute. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, with local amounts up to 15 inches over peaks, are expected. * WHERE...Shasta Lake Area / Northern Shasta County and Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County above 4,500 feet. * WHEN...5 PM today to 1 PM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibilities at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
